name: Newport Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I was in Newport with my 3 kids 12, 12 and 6 years old. We decided whilst on the beach to stay overnight. On hotels.com I found a very good deal on a room here with 2 queen beds. When we arrived late afternoon we were informed we had been upgraded to a queen deluxe. In our room we had 2 queen beds, massage chair, good size fridge, microwave, jacuzzi tub for two and a bathroom with tub / shower. Flat screen tv, desk, table and two chairs and large bureau. Everyone at the front desk was helpful.The room itself was clean, looked a little tried and drab but large. Working ac unit. I sat in the lobby to use the wifi and heard the front desk recommending take out places and they had all the menus on hand. There is also a non heated pool which has an open ceiling. My kids enjoyed that, little too cold for me! Breakfast was included and sufficient. Plastic cutlery and paper plates, fine by me if that keeps the cost down! Toast, waffles, cereal, yogurts, strawberries, donuts, pastries, pop tarts, nutra grain bars. People did seem to be having a problem with the waffle iron! I was hesitant about booking the room because of the poor reviews but I am very glad I did. The hotel was less than 10 minutes to second beach. A couple of minutes from stop n shop.
reviews.title: Last minute stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: A motel would have been better than this place, even better than the so called luxury room. It seems like years ago this hotel might have been decent. If you want to pay twice as much or more for a bed to sleep in, which by the way you'd never know how long it'd before they change the sheets. When they changed the sheets in our room, ours came with some stains which appeared to be blood or $#!7- surprise!
reviews.title: STAY AWAY!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had to keep calling to restock our room . you'd be lucky if you get towels. You might not always get housekeeping done!. Wanna watch anything on tv, if you only like basic cable you'd enjoy that 40' tv. There isn't a restaurant there, no bar, no game room as some sites claim. It's just a motel with a pool that closes at night, a small jacuzzi and depending on what time you go to the front desk you might be surprised with a rude person behind the counter when asking questions about the hotel.
reviews.title: Beware!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Newport inn - where you pay MORE and get the LOWEST.
reviews.title: my getaway
Clean, comfy & fun
reviews.text: Photos on site are lies. There was a condom under the bed of the "cleaned" room. We went to folk festival came back to a room that had not been cleaned. They said they would credit us and then there was an additional charge on the bill. We were called 60 days before our stay for them to say the suite we had booked would not be available ,but we could have two rooms for an additional $500 and if we didn't like it too bad. One disaster after another!!!! It is a real dump!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed here for the weekend (12/28-12/31/2007) and we loved it. The rooms were very clean, we had a whirlpool in the room (again, very clean). There were massage chairs in the lobby area as well as a separate room with 5 massage chairs and a big screen TV (All free of charge and no children allowed). I recommend this place as we would go back whenever we are in the Newport area.
reviews.title: Loved It

likes.disliked: — The children in the pool (but what can ya do?)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I may be wrong but the previous review sounds like it was written by the owner of the place...
reviews.title: disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in December and were extremely disappointed. Our rooms (2) on the second floor were outdated and not very clean. There were ceiling tiles hanging off. The bathroom had stains on the floor and hairs on the floor. Oh yeah, and there were parts of the door molding on the inside of the room door that were torn off and left without replacing.
reviews.title: Love Newport Spa and Whirlpool Suites
Fantastic
reviews.text: The pool was "beautiful"? That is sketchy. There was so much BLACK mold on the falling apart ceiling it was atrocious, not too mention zero ventiliation (a requirement for indoor pools), so there was so much condensation from the ceiling (water dripping) everything was soaked with water, including the rack of pool towels....Oh, and the hot tubs? There were two of the "blow up" kind (not the kind in-ground)not functioning, covered with dirty tarps with gallons of green bacteria infested water floating over it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We left and stayed at a more reputable, much nicer chain hotel for the same money.
reviews.title: disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: For my birthday 2 of my girlfriends brought here for a couple days. I saw some bad reviews before coming but my friend insisted that I shouldn't be worried. She has stayed here before and liked it enough to go back again. When we checked in there was a bowl of fresh fruit on the counter. I thought that was nice. The girl checking us in was very pleasant.
reviews.title: I liked this place a lot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very clean and pretty roomy too. The bed was awesome very comfortable they're temperpedic beds. We found a freezer in the breakfast room that was fully stocked with ice cream! That was very cool- we definitely got our money's worth out of that alone. It also had bags of ice which was great to pack our coolers with for the beach.
reviews.title: Stay anywhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Later at night we wanted to go out. The hotel had a driver to drop us off and picked us up late at night.
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: In the morning we enjoyed sitting outside getting some sun and went for a swim in the pool. The water was so nice. Wasn't too cold- it was really nice.
reviews.title: bad....bad....bad....bad...hotel ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over all we had a really nice visit. My friend was right- the place was great I'd definitely go back again.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed two nights 9/26 & 27. Great welcome at the front desk by the owner. We were upgraded to a large room with a whirlpool bath, fridge microwave, coffee maker and two of the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in. Breakfast was good. make your own waffles, toast, danish, fruit, yogurt, juice and very good coffee in a very nice room. Everyone at the front desk was nice, especially Nicky. Will be back to this super clean hotel next year. Thanks Again.
reviews.title: Very Clean--Very Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed at Newport Inn for 2 nights, and even though it was short, my family had a terrific time because of the location (its nearby a lot of scenic areas, including Newport -a must see place!), and because of one particular staff (Melissa) at the hotel that made our stay even more worthwhile. She wasn't the person that checked us in the first day, but I wish I had run into her earlier because she gave us a lot of suggestions to take our 5 year old daughter, but it was our last night there. Even so, we squeezed in some time to visit some of the places she suggested. Melissa was very friendly and she definitely had great customer service. I'm the type of person that likes to meet people who actually enjoy what they do for a living, and not take out their personal issues on their customers. The pool was a bit cold since it wasn't heated, but the whirlpool inside our room had made up for it. Overall, the place was nice and decent in price.
reviews.title: Nice place for a family vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Stayed for onw night. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The room we stayed im was very big and comfortable. im am not comming from very far away but just going over the bridge feels like another world away. I will be back!
reviews.title: Excellent for the price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reasonably priced hotel, only 3 miles from the wharfs. Nothing bad to say about this hotel. Property was very clean and up to date. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a spacious room with a jacuzzi in it. It also had a refrigerator, microwave, and coffee pot. The bed was very comfortable and the style of the room (ie. Wallpaper, carpet, and linens) was modern. We came back in the evening after a night in town to find the fire pit lit. We enjoyed sitting by the fire for a while before going up to our room. Continental breakfast was included.
reviews.title: Very Nice! Highly Recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: booked the hotel last minute, it was worth for 99 $. Room was clean(they checked again before i went in),jacuzzi was working, a short drive to newport. Staff was helpful. hotel is in a good location , plenty of takeout places around you. will def stay again.
reviews.title: will stay again
Avoid it if you can
reviews.text: Before booking here, I checked the TripAdvisor reviews and realized this place could be trouble. But, they had renovated since most reviews were posted. So, I called and confirmed that all rooms had, in fact, been renovated, and we booked for 2 nights. Well, this is a case of renovations gone bad. I've rarely seen so many examples of poor carpentry, shoddy workmanship, carpets installed terribly, wobbly light fixtures, construction incomplete with materials left in the stairs, and even plywood patching parts of the fiberglass roof over the pool. If you don't mind staying in one step up from a trailer park, this is your place. I don't give it a 1-star because it does have Temperpedic beds and the rooms and facilities are clean. But, if you can afford someplace else in the Newport area, don't stay here.

reviews.title: The worst customer service I've ever experienced
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Newport Inn and Spa during his birthday weekend. Sat. morning we discovered my windshild was smashed and my 900.00 GPS was stolen. The hotel did not offer any compensation not even a refund for the previous night. Our weekend was distroyed and I was out alot of money, over $1,100 (including the

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: window needing replacement) The manager refused to speak to me when I called to see if I could have a complimentary night for what had happend. The worst customer I've ever experienced. Turns out that the
reviews.title: Okay for the Price
Not it
reviews.text: security guard had called in sick that night and just so happens that

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: is the night my car was broken in to. I was not allowed to speak with
reviews.title: Ant Attack

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I booked this room prior to seeing any reviews on this website. A couple of weeks before our stay my wife happened upon this
reviews.title: Lighten Up

likes.disliked: — There was only one way into the parking lot that right at the foot of a busy intersection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: site and saw the reviews, most of which were pretty poor. I was hesitant at first, but reminded myself that we were staying close to Newport, and the standards of the typical Newport vacationer was probably much higher than your average vacationer. So with a bit of hesitation we kept the room and set off to experience what could be a great stay...or a disaster.
reviews.title: Will Never Stay again- Worst Honeymoon Location

likes.disliked: — The odors and lack of cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we arrived we saw "the sign" referred to as rusty in another review, a little weathered maybe, but by no means did it project a dumpy motel.
reviews.title: Big disappointment

likes.disliked: — The appearance of the hotel which did not look renovated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we pulled up the building looked nice, the same when we entered the lobby. It was bright, clean, and had a welcoming atmosphere. The woman at the desk (I forget her name) was extremely pleasant. She got us checked in and in our room in barely 2 minutes.
reviews.title: Good enough if cheap enough

likes.liked: — proximity to the mansions,easy parking, comfortable bed
likes.disliked: — posted rate does NOT reflect the facility. Only stay if you get a steal of a deal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was nice, clean and there were no strange smells. The furniture in the room was tasteful and fit the room nicely. The bed was in fact a King Size temperpedic....and the bedding was typical of a hotels bedding, and it was clean. The pillows were a little flat, but there were plenty in the room so if you prefer a fluffy pillow there are plenty to stack on top of one another.
reviews.title: Spa HA!

likes.disliked: — The lack of heatpool/spa/friendly informative staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My sister and I booked a room at the Newport Inn this past weekend. It was our first visit to the Newport area and we had a blast. The staff was nice. It was kind of funny, they even had a fridge filled with ice cream for their guests. Our room was comfy & clean and it had a nice big tub in it. When we were done walking around Newport (it was so HOT outside!), we went back to the hotel and enjoyed the pool. We were surprised that it wasn't crazy crowded, but it wasn't. Someone told me it had just been redone by a reality TV show. They'd left before we arrived, but we thought that was pretty cool! If you want to work out, they have a gym, too.
reviews.title: Beautiful pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: My wife & I stayed here while attending an engagement party for my sister in Newport. I was hesitant based on some of the reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised. A buddy of mine saw this hotel on a show called "Hotel Impossible" the other night. I guess it's like that show "Restaurant Impossible" where a team of professionals come in & tear the place apart & then fix it up. I missed the episode, but I'm assuming they did a good job because the place looks really good. Our room was clean & the staff was friendly. Free breakfast with waffle station was a nice touch. My wife spent a few hours by the pool & she was told that it was just renovated for the show. Overall a nice place. No room service, but there are a lot of area restaurants that deliver to your room, so no biggie. The rate was fair & far less than some other area hotels.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: I stayed last night with my husband & two children. The room was very clean. The hotel was recently featured on The Travel Channel's "Hotel Impossible" and they obviously learned a lot, because the hotel was much nicer than previous reviews. We wanted to check out the hotel after we saw the show! The renovated pool area is gorgeous! My children didn't want to leave! Wish we could have stayed anther night!
reviews.title: Great for families!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would rather stay a week in The Shining's hotel than stay one more hour in this dump. The bed was disgusting and every part of the hotel was not cared for. It also smelled in the hallways and must have been deorated by blind people. It felt like a military base versus a cozy place you would expect to find in the Newport area.
reviews.title: Most Disgusting Awful Hotel in Rhode Island!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: The worst part was the price. You would expect to get a decent room for the high cost of a nights stay here. Avoid at all cost. I hate to recommend a Holiday Inn but it would be an improvement.
reviews.title: Tolerably dingy, if you must stay--do not expect to have a romantic getaway.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel looked okay on online...in person was a different story! We booked the most expensive room with a Jacuzzi. The room was very small and the Jacuzzi was an add-on shoved in a corner surrounded by 3 walls. The bathroom was so small that the door nearly hit the toilet and in order to turn the shower on you had to negotiate around the toilet. The vent in the bathroom went directly into the neighboring bathroom so you could hear everything in the room next door. The pool was disgusting and the hot tubs were wrapped in tarps and didn't have any water in them. We stayed one of the two nights we had booked. We found another hotel for the second night.
reviews.title: Don't stay here!!

likes.liked: — They let us leave a day early without hassle.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading several bad reviews online, I was a little nervous to stay at the Newport Inn and Spa. Luckily, I had a wonderful stay!
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived 4 hours before check - in time and asked if it would be possible to check in early. Not only did they let us do this, they also offered us a free upgrade. Instead of a normal room, we were given a room with a whirlpool (at no extra charge!).
reviews.title: Disgusting!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and modern, with a coffee maker, TV, fridge, and clock radio. The bathroom was a little small but it was clean and very nice. When I called the front desk for some extra towels (at 9:30 pm) they were very nice and brought the towels to the room in less than 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Loved it!
Best Time for a 2nd honeymoon
reviews.text: Although I did not swim in the pool, I did visit it. It was very clean and attractive.

aka: Newport Inn And Whirlpool Hotel Middletown
description: Two-story hotel, 3 miles north of downtown Newport. 1/2 mile from Naval Academy, Naval Base, NUWC, 3 miles from beach. All rooms have Tempurpedic mattresses, refrigerators, microwaves, coffee pots, restaurant, full health club, indoor pool, game room, 60 rooms have extended stay amenities, kitchenettes, stoves.
